title: Citibank Peru Launches Fifth Journalism Awards for Excellence
summary: Lima - For the fifth year in a row, Citibank Peru is promoting the Citi Journalism Awards for Excellence to recognize outstanding articles by the Peruvian print media analyzing financial, economic and business issues that have generated impact and value in our community.
tag-1: Citibank Peru Launches Fifth Journalism Awards for Excellence
tag-3: Lima – For the fifth year in a row, Citibank Peru is promoting the Citi Journalism Awards for Excellence to recognize outstanding articles by the Peruvian print media analyzing financial, economic and business issues that have generated impact and value in our community.
tag-4: The initiative is designed to promote the development of quality journalism in countries within Citibank's global network. The winner will have the opportunity to spend 10 days in New York City to participate in the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism Business and Finance, which Citi sponsors.
tag-5: "These awards are an excellent opportunity to recognize the work of Peruvian journalists who specialize in economic issues and thank them for their important role in benefiting society and economic development," said Jose Antonio Blanco, General Manager of Citibank Peru. "The competition is held in more than 37 countries where Citi has a presence and seeks out the best in economic journalism at the global level."
tag-6: The winning journalist will be invited to participate in intensive accountability and finance workshops with distinguished faculty members from Columbia University, engage in discussions with academics and political authorities and visit important U.S. financial institutions and government offices. Since the program was launched, more than 300 journalists from approximately 100 media outlets have attended the seminar.
tag-7: "To evaluate and select the winning articles, we have convened a panel of experts who will choose the finalists according to strict criteria for quality and objectivity. The finalists will be reviewed by Columbia's Graduate School of Journalism, which will name the winner," Blanco explained.
tag-8: Participants must have a good command of the English language. The competition is limited to articles, pieces or reports published in the Peruvian print media or websites. Submissions will be accepted through January 31.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
